abstract: Iowa jury finds Henry Rayhons not guilty of charges he sexually abused his wife Donna, an Alzheimer's patient, by having physical relations with her after being told she was medically unable to give consent; Rayhons had faced up to 10 years in prison on felony charge, and his case ignited national debate over ability of dementia patients to consent to sexual intimacy.
lead_paragraph: Henry Rayhons was accused of sexually abusing his wife in a nursing home after staff members told him she had become cognitively unable to give consent.

headline.main: Iowa Man Found Not Guilty of Sexually Abusing Wife With Alzheimer’s
headline.print_headline: Man Found Not Guilty of Abusing Ailing Wife

snippet: Henry Rayhons was accused of sexually abusing his wife in a nursing home after staff members told him she had become cognitively unable to give consent.
